meanings.definition: To throw out of a window.
meanings.sent1: She was defenestrating the old furniture to make space in the room.
meanings.sent2: The cat kept defenestrating the toys off the windowsill.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to enjoy defenestrating acorns onto the unsuspecting pedestrians below.
meanings.sent4: The storm was so strong that it felt like nature was defenestrating everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The image of the superhero defenestrating the villain out of the skyscraper was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: The act of throwing someone or something out of a window.
meanings.sent1: The defenestrating of the vase was accidental, but it made a loud crash.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the defenestrating of the old TV was both shocking and amusing.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch involved a hilarious defenestrating of a cake during a party scene.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the defenestrating of secrets led to unexpected revelations.
meanings.sent5: The historical event known as the Defenestration of Prague involved the defenestrating of officials from a window.
